page.title: 07THE RAILWAY IN SELHAM
page.content: In 1857 the{Mid Sussex Railway constructed a line from{Horsham}to {Petworth.}The extension to Midhurst was opened on 15th October 1866. The wooden station at {Selham}was constructed in{1872.}The villagers now had direct access to London by rail. The {passenger service}to Pulborough was closed on 23rd May 1955.The goods {service }to Midhurst and Pulborough operated until May 1963 although the goods yard itself had been closed earlier.The line was closed on 12th October 1964. An interesting feature of{Selham Station}was that passengers and cattle had separate roads to approach the platforms. There is a splendid collection of photographs in{"Branch Lines to {Midhurst"}Keith Smith and Vic Mitchell published by Middleton Press,1981.
